Articles.Content:
Ok, I went to the astronaut complex and what I saw? I saw eleven Kerbals with "Kerman" surname.

Why can't you add some more interesting surnames like "Kaldrin" or anything?

Ok there's a list of surnames I came up with:

-Kerstrong

-Kaldrin

-Kerrins

-Kekerin

-Kermeshevsky

I'm sure this will be implemented eventually, but it's probably low priority. Like, SUPER low priority. Patience, young grasshopper.

Oh, and happy first post! Welcome to the KSP forums!
All Kerbals have that surname. It's just how the devs wanted to make it I guess.
Perhaps this allows us to conclude something about the way Kerbals reproduce.

I think they have plenty of Surnames right now

*Why would you suggest those Surnames? They are clichÃƒÂ© and have nothing to do with the KSP universe.

Edited July 31, 2013 by Trux
This is an integral part of my 'Kerbals are really Von Neuman machines' meta-narrative though...

Female names, or even female Kerbals.

There are female names. Sherry Kerman is currently escaping Kerbol.
Canonically, all Kerbals are genderless. Apart from the original trio, I pick pronouns for them mostly randomly.

I'm sure this will be implemented eventually, but it's probably low priority. Like, SUPER low priority. Patience, young grasshopper.

Oh, and happy first post! Welcome to the KSP forums!

It isn't really my first post because I had an account on KSP forum, but I stopped visiting it few months ago and they deleted my account, so i registered there one more time.
Maybe they're something like asari in Mass Effect and they can reproduce with other species.

Even if we wanted to keep the "Kerbin" theme going, here are some more suggestions (similar names in parentheses):

Kerbman (Kerbmann)

Kerbinson (Kerbson)

Kerbenmeyer (Kerbmeyer, Kerbmeier)

Kerbowski

Kerbez

Kerbil

I think it'd be really cool if some of the less-known Kerbals or randomly generated ones had a little more variety in their last names, even if they are all Kerbal-themed and have the word "Kerb" in them.

Kerbals don't have surnames. "Kerman" isn't a surname, it's something like "Mister".

Prooflink
closing this as it is a Necro post.
